page.title: 14CRAFTS IN SHILLINGSTONE
page.content: There are several artists living in my village who are often found around the back lanes with palette and canvas capturing our lovely countryside scenes. We have a resident silversmith who makes the most beautiful items.He is an elderly gentleman and greatly admired.A group of ladies have weaving looms and produce patterned shawls. We have a thriving patchwork and quilting group who made a hand sewn quilt which was sold to raise money for the school.There is a woodworker who makes children's toys,and a lady who makes soft toys for all age groups.Another group makes silk flowers.There are potteries in two nearby villages.The Shillingstone School Action Committee organises a major Art and Craft Exhibition annually at the School.
